data.title: Incredible array of choices
data.text: Asked locals to suggest a good restaurant to go to before seeing a show at the performing arts center and they sent me here, and I am glad they did. The atmosphere was comfortable and intimate. The were so many choices on the menu that it took some time to decide. Priced right and good portion.

data.title: Greek + a whole lot more
data.text:
Tazza is a mid size place right near downtown.  The menu is huge and has a ton of options for all tastes.  It certainly isn't fancy but a very comfortable place to meet and have a good meal.  The staff is nice and the food came out pretty quickly.  

A great place to go if you want to get out of the hustle of downtown and get a quality meal at a very affordable price.

data.title: To tired to cook, order takeout/delivery
data.text: After a long day at the Tri-Star Kennel Club dog show, I didn't want to go out for dinner so searched the web for delivery. Tazza website and menu sounded appealing. I ordered the Chicken Artichoke Alfredo and Key Lime pie. The order stated 1 HR but surprisingly it was here in 30 min, hot and excellent. And all for $23 including tip!!

data.title: Greek
data.text: Tazza is definitely a place to visit when in Nashville if you like Greek!!  Everything on the menu is authentic!!

data.title: The Food is Fair
data.text: Tazza has a very large menu with a wide variety of food . Salads, sandwiches , Italian, burgers and more. The service is good, the prices are good and the portions are generous. The food is fair . It is just okay. I think it lacks seasoning and flavor. I have eaten here about 3 times. My salads were good, soup bland, and burgers fair .

data.title: Unsatisfactory
data.text: My friends and I stopped here for lunch when Puckett's was too crowded. The menu is way too big! Our waitress was unable or unwilling to give any suggestions. I ordered a sirloin burger which wasn't what I thought I was ordering so that was a bust. 3 of us ordered the baked ziti which was tasteless. The waitress only had a few tables but rarely was available to refill drinks. My advice is to skip this place.

data.title: Tazza for Dinner!
data.text: We chose Tazza for dinner on our last night in Nashville.  Their menu is huge!  Almost too much to choose from, but we all managed to find a dish to order.  They don't serve liquor, but you can BYO...which we did because we knew ahead of time.  We dined early, so the restaurant was pretty much empty.  There is plenty of seating for large groups.  The waitress was attentive but quiet.  The food was very good and we had salad as well!

data.title: Nice place, Quiet: good food, nice waitress--No Wine , beer or cocktails
data.text:
Honestly, we came here because Puckett's was packed and my reservation was incorrectly placed.
BUT we had a good meal--Chicken parmigiana and since the place was quiet could have a nice conversation --Because Puckett's was screaming loud.

data.title: Party of 11 arrived about 8:30pm on
data.text:
Party of 11 arrived about 8:30pm on a Friday night.  There were 3-4 other large groups ( 6-10) ,all being served by the same waitress.  We were seated promptly by putting some smaller tables together. And followed by 2 more groups.  The line waitress did a great job and never seemed frazzled .  The menu is overwhelming.  Can a very small restaurant really do 75 dishes that well?  I gave up and picked a pasta.  My wife and I shared a nice salad.  
I would say the food is average- not great but was a nice convenient late night casual dinner.
Oh, we bought apiece of chocolate cake from cooler and took back to hotel.  Other desserts looked goodI also.  Cake  was excellent!

data.title: Pretty good, reasonable prices
data.text: Hubby and I ate at this restaurant one evening during the week.  The place was very busy and the one server worked very hard and kept things moving but one is not enough.  We both had grilled mahi mahi with, according to the menu, grilled vegetables.  The fish was fine, although I would suspect it was frozen. The vegetables were definitely from a bag of frozen vegetables, and were just microwaved or steamed, not grilled.  If you can, sit toward the front where the noise level should be lower.

data.title: Great Late Meal!
data.text: My wife, son, and I were out and about downtown and had pushed off finding a meal until it was quite late... luckily we stumbled upon this place! My wife had a salmon Caesar salad and I had the eggplant parmesan...both of the meals were excellent! The wait staff was very friendly even though we came in within an hour of closing! Highly recommended...

data.title: Yummmmm
data.text: Great place-- our first visit!   Delicious salads and sandwiches!  Try the humas and pita slices-- you will not be disappointed!

data.title: Tazzo
data.text: Great food and great prices.  It is in a good location.  The menu consist of burgers, wings, spaghetti, and just about anything else.

data.title: Huge menu selection
data.text: Stopped in here after we found out it was a 2 hour wait at Puckett's down the street.  I had the New Orleans Pasta which was a good spicy sauce over a mix of sausage, shrimp and pasta. It was very good.  My wife enjoyed the manicotti but the taste of it that I had was nothing special.  If you want a glass of wine with your meal you'll have to bring your own.  The food was good, service attentive, and the prices very reasonable.

data.title: Heart of town
data.text: We ate here every day of CMA week and the food was excellent each time. Same 2 waitresses were there every day and they were very pleasant in spite of being incredibly busy.

data.title: Small treasure
data.text: We stumbled upon this place because it was directly in front of the condo we stayed at. It is small but the food is delicious!! We didn't have to wait either time we went. Great!

data.title: Good food for very low prices.
data.text: My husband and I go here each time we are in Nashville. We enjoy the quiet atmosphere. The menu has a ton of options for pretty much anyone. I ordered tiramisu and it was huge! We spent $25 for everything!

data.title: Very good low budget meal
data.text: The prices at this little gem eatery are so ridiculously low we nearly didn't venture in. We just needed a bite to eat after a busy day and as Tazza was directly across the road from our apartment we popped in late one night. Very glad we did. $30 for 3 of us - the menu is so extensive, there's so much to choose from. This is really, really good for the price. And they deliver too.

data.title: Nice Meal. Spicy Pasta.
data.text: Pucketts had over an hour wait so we tried this place close by. We were happy with our meals and service. My wife had a cheese pizza and I asked waitress what she recommended and had the New Orleans Pasta. Loved the Pasta dish and my wife liked the Pizza. Friendly service. No Beer or Wine available . Would go back. Recommend the Pasta Dish.

data.title: Dissatisfied
data.text: We walked in and there was no wait when the wait everywhere else was about an hour and a half. They sat us at a small dark booth in the back next to a loud group of about 30. The menu had such small print and so many items it was nearly impossible to read, for example there we about 30 items on just the appetizer list. Our waitress was polite but oddly jumpy. The food was alright but I could tell that everything they brought to the table had been frozen.
